org.apache.flink.streaming.connectors.fs.bucketing

类 BucketingSink<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.AbstractRichFunction
      • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.functions.sink.RichSinkFunction<T>
        • org.apache.flink.streaming.connectors.fs.bucketing.BucketingSink<T>
  • 类型参数:
    T - Type of the elements emitted by this sink
    所有已实现的接口:
    java.io.Serializable, Function, RichFunction, InputTypeConfigurable, CheckpointListener, CheckpointedFunction, SinkFunction<T>, ProcessingTimeCallback

    public class BucketingSink<T>
extends RichSinkFunction<T>
implements InputTypeConfigurable, CheckpointedFunction, CheckpointListener, ProcessingTimeCallback
    Sink that emits its input elements to FileSystem files within buckets. This is integrated with the checkpointing mechanism to provide exactly once semantics.

    When creating the sink a basePath must be specified. The base directory contains one directory for every bucket. The bucket directories themselves contain several part files, one for each parallel subtask of the sink. These part files contain the actual output data.

    The sink uses a Bucketer to determine in which bucket directory each element should be written to inside the base directory. The Bucketer can, for example, use time or a property of the element to determine the bucket directory. The default Bucketer is a DateTimeBucketer which will create one new bucket every hour. You can specify a custom Bucketer using setBucketer(Bucketer). For example, use the BasePathBucketer if you don't want to have buckets but still want to write part-files in a fault-tolerant way.

    The filenames of the part files contain the part prefix, the parallel subtask index of the sink and a rolling counter. For example the file "part-1-17" contains the data from subtask 1 of the sink and is the 17th bucket created by that subtask. Per default the part prefix is "part" but this can be configured using setPartPrefix(String). When a part file becomes bigger than the user-specified batch size the current part file is closed, the part counter is increased and a new part file is created. The batch size defaults to 384MB, this can be configured using setBatchSize(long).

    In some scenarios, the open buckets are required to change based on time. In these cases, the sink needs to determine when a bucket has become inactive, in order to flush and close the part file. To support this there are two configurable settings:

    1. the frequency to check for inactive buckets, configured by setInactiveBucketCheckInterval(long), and
    2. the minimum amount of time a bucket has to not receive any data before it is considered inactive, configured by setInactiveBucketThreshold(long)
    Both of these parameters default to 60, 000 ms, or 1 min.

    Part files can be in one of three states: in-progress, pending or finished. The reason for this is how the sink works together with the checkpointing mechanism to provide exactly-once semantics and fault-tolerance. The part file that is currently being written to is in-progress. Once a part file is closed for writing it becomes pending. When a checkpoint is successful the currently pending files will be moved to finished.

    If case of a failure, and in order to guarantee exactly-once semantics, the sink should roll back to the state it had when that last successful checkpoint occurred. To this end, when restoring, the restored files in pending state are transferred into the finished state while any in-progress files are rolled back, so that they do not contain data that arrived after the checkpoint from which we restore. If the FileSystem supports the truncate() method this will be used to reset the file back to its previous state. If not, a special file with the same name as the part file and the suffix ".valid-length" will be created that contains the length up to which the file contains valid data. When reading the file, it must be ensured that it is only read up to that point. The prefixes and suffixes for the different file states and valid-length files can be configured using the adequate setter method, e.g. setPendingSuffix(String).

    NOTE:

    1. If checkpointing is not enabled the pending files will never be moved to the finished state. In that case, the pending suffix/prefix can be set to "" to make the sink work in a non-fault-tolerant way but still provide output without prefixes and suffixes.
    2. The part files are written using an instance of Writer. By default, a StringWriter is used, which writes the result of toString() for every element, separated by newlines. You can configure the writer using the setWriter(Writer). For example, SequenceFileWriter can be used to write Hadoop SequenceFiles.

    Example: 

    
     new BucketingSink<Tuple2<IntWritable, Text>>(outPath)
         .setWriter(new SequenceFileWriter<IntWritable, Text>())
         .setBucketer(new DateTimeBucketer("yyyy-MM-dd--HHmm")

    This will create a sink that writes to SequenceFiles and rolls every minute.

    另请参阅:
    DateTimeBucketer, StringWriter, SequenceFileWriter, 序列化表格

      嵌套类 
      限定符和类型 类和说明
      (专用程序包) static class  BucketingSink.BucketState<T>
      This is used for keeping track of the current in-progress buckets and files that we mark for moving from pending to final location after we get a checkpoint-complete notification.
      (专用程序包) static class  BucketingSink.State<T>
      This is used during snapshot/restore to keep track of in-progress buckets.

        The state object that is handled by Flink from snapshot/restore. This contains state for every open bucket: the current in-progress part file path, its valid length and the pending part files.

    • 构造器详细资料

      • BucketingSink

        public BucketingSink(java.lang.String basePath)
        Creates a new BucketingSink that writes files to the given base directory.

        This uses aDateTimeBucketer as Bucketer and a StringWriter has writer. The maximum bucket size is set to 384 MB.

        参数:
        basePath - The directory to which to write the bucket files.

      • open

        public void open(Configuration parameters)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        从接口复制的说明: RichFunction
        Initialization method for the function. It is called before the actual working methods (like map or join) and thus suitable for one time setup work. For functions that are part of an iteration, this method will be invoked at the beginning of each iteration superstep.

        The configuration object passed to the function can be used for configuration and initialization. The configuration contains all parameters that were configured on the function in the program composition. 

        
 public class MyMapper extends FilterFunction<String> {
 
     private String searchString;
     
     public void open(Configuration parameters) {
         this.searchString = parameters.getString("foo");
     }
     
     public boolean filter(String value) {
         return value.equals(searchString);
     }
 }

        By default, this method does nothing.

        指定者:
        open 在接口中 RichFunction
        覆盖:
        open 在类中 AbstractRichFunction
        参数:
        parameters - The configuration containing the parameters attached to the contract.
        抛出:
        java.lang.Exception - Implementations may forward exceptions, which are caught by the runtime. When the runtime catches an exception, it aborts the task and lets the fail-over logic decide whether to retry the task execution.
        另请参阅:
        Configuration

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        从接口复制的说明: RichFunction
        Tear-down method for the user code. It is called after the last call to the main working methods (e.g. map or join). For functions that are part of an iteration, this method will be invoked after each iteration superstep.

        This method can be used for clean up work.

        指定者:
        close 在接口中 RichFunction
        覆盖:
        close 在类中 AbstractRichFunction
        抛出:
        java.lang.Exception - Implementations may forward exceptions, which are caught by the runtime. When the runtime catches an exception, it aborts the task and lets the fail-over logic decide whether to retry the task execution.

      • shouldRoll

        private boolean shouldRoll(BucketingSink.BucketState<T> bucketState)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns true if the current part-file should be closed and a new should be created. This happens if:
        1. no file is created yet for the task to write to, or
        2. the current file has reached the maximum bucket size.
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException

      • onProcessingTime

        public void onProcessingTime(long timestamp)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        从接口复制的说明: ProcessingTimeCallback
        This method is invoked with the timestamp for which the trigger was scheduled.

        If the triggering is delayed for whatever reason (trigger timer was blocked, JVM stalled due to a garbage collection), the timestamp supplied to this function will still be the original timestamp for which the trigger was scheduled.

        指定者:
        onProcessingTime 在接口中 ProcessingTimeCallback
        参数:
        timestamp - The timestamp for which the trigger event was scheduled.
        抛出:
        java.lang.Exception

      • checkForInactiveBuckets

        private void checkForInactiveBuckets(long currentProcessingTime)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks for inactive buckets, and closes them. Buckets are considered inactive if they have not been written to for a period greater than inactiveBucketThreshold ms. This enables in-progress files to be moved to the pending state and be finalised on the next checkpoint.
        抛出:
        java.lang.Exception

      • openNewPartFile

        private void openNewPartFile(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path bucketPath,
                             BucketingSink.BucketState<T> bucketState)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes the current part file and opens a new one with a new bucket path, as returned by the Bucketer. If the bucket is not new, then this will create a new file with the same path as its predecessor, but with an increased rolling counter (see BucketingSink.
        抛出:
        java.lang.Exception

      • closeCurrentPartFile

        private void closeCurrentPartFile(BucketingSink.BucketState<T> bucketState)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes the current part file and moves it from the in-progress state to the pending state.
        抛出:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setBatchSize

        public BucketingSink<T> setBatchSize(long batchSize)
        Sets the maximum bucket size in bytes.

        When a bucket part file becomes larger than this size a new bucket part file is started and the old one is closed. The name of the bucket files depends on the Bucketer.

        参数:
        batchSize - The bucket part file size in bytes.

      • setInactiveBucketCheckInterval

        public BucketingSink<T> setInactiveBucketCheckInterval(long interval)
        Sets the default time between checks for inactive buckets.
        参数:
        interval - The timeout, in milliseconds.

      • setInactiveBucketThreshold

        public BucketingSink<T> setInactiveBucketThreshold(long threshold)
        Sets the default threshold for marking a bucket as inactive and closing its part files. Buckets which haven't been written to for at least this period of time become inactive.
        参数:
        threshold - The timeout, in milliseconds.

      • setBucketer

        public BucketingSink<T> setBucketer(Bucketer<T> bucketer)
        Sets the Bucketer to use for determining the bucket files to write to.
        参数:
        bucketer - The bucketer to use.

      • setWriter

        public BucketingSink<T> setWriter(Writer<T> writer)
        Sets the Writer to be used for writing the incoming elements to bucket files.
        参数:
        writer - The Writer to use.

      • setInProgressSuffix

        public BucketingSink<T> setInProgressSuffix(java.lang.String inProgressSuffix)
        Sets the suffix of in-progress part files. The default is "in-progress".

      • setInProgressPrefix

        public BucketingSink<T> setInProgressPrefix(java.lang.String inProgressPrefix)
        Sets the prefix of in-progress part files. The default is "_".

      • setPendingSuffix

        public BucketingSink<T> setPendingSuffix(java.lang.String pendingSuffix)
        Sets the suffix of pending part files. The default is ".pending".

      • setPendingPrefix

        public BucketingSink<T> setPendingPrefix(java.lang.String pendingPrefix)
        Sets the prefix of pending part files. The default is "_".

      • setValidLengthSuffix

        public BucketingSink<T> setValidLengthSuffix(java.lang.String validLengthSuffix)
        Sets the suffix of valid-length files. The default is ".valid-length".

      • setValidLengthPrefix

        public BucketingSink<T> setValidLengthPrefix(java.lang.String validLengthPrefix)
        Sets the prefix of valid-length files. The default is "_".

      • setPartPrefix

        public BucketingSink<T> setPartPrefix(java.lang.String partPrefix)
        Sets the prefix of part files. The default is "part".

      • disableCleanupOnOpen

        @Deprecated
public BucketingSink<T> disableCleanupOnOpen()
        已过时。 This option is deprecated and remains only for backwards compatibility. We do not clean up lingering files anymore.
        Disable cleanup of leftover in-progress/pending files when the sink is opened.

        This should only be disabled if using the sink without checkpoints, to not remove the files already in the directory.

      • setAsyncTimeout

        public BucketingSink<T> setAsyncTimeout(long timeout)
        Sets the default timeout for asynchronous operations such as recoverLease and truncate.
        参数:
        timeout - The timeout, in milliseconds.

        @VisibleForTesting
public BucketingSink.State<T> getState()

      • createHadoopFileSystem

        public static org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem createHadoopFileSystem(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path,
                                                                     @Nullable
                                                                     Configuration extraUserConf)
                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException
